Reviews.Title: “never will stay there again!!!”
Reviews.Author: leilare
Reviews.Content: We buy a Gustaso to stay in thi hotel .... This hotel is the worst we ever visit . The hotel is old , dirty and stained . The room smell bad . Our stay it was supose to be 2 nights 3 days ... we left the first night .... we lost our money :(

Reviews.Title: “Never again!”
Reviews.Author: juststrange
Reviews.Content: This place is the worst. Everything is old, dirty and digusting. There is nothing positive to say. The sheets are old and stained, the bathtub was dirty, I showered with my water shoes on in fear of catching fungus, the pool was green and filthy. The waiter in the resturant was really nice as were the front desk staff. They even handed me a light bulb when I informed them that the light bulb in room was in need of replacement. (yes, I am being sarcastic) they were very nice, it just is not an any star hotel. Will not return.

Reviews.Title: “Average hotel when you consider others in the area”
Reviews.Author: TamandPete
Reviews.Content: This hotel was a stop along our trip around/across Puerto Rico. There are three floors to his hotel. From the exterior it looks like the best and largest hotel in the area. The staff was friendly and spoke English well, which was never a concern any were during out trip. Our room was a king size room on the second floor and in the corner. It was very large and clean, but dated. The carpet is worn and the room did have a damp semll to it. The bathroom is large, white and very clean. For short term, it is fine. The bed was average for sleeping in. There is nice pool and free parking. We were driving and it was easy to find our way to the hotel. The hotel is in Joyuda and other than a lot of seafood restaurants, there is nothing to do within walking distance. Not even a beach. We drove to Cabo Rojo (maybe 10 mins away) for dinner and to Mayaguez for shopping. It all very close together. We visited Bosque Estatal de Boqueron which was nothing more than a short walk through some thin forest, the Cabo Rojo salt flats and the light house - El Far de Cabo Rojos which is a must see. The drive down the dirt road is slow and full of dips and bumps. From there we went to Guanica and spend the afternoon on gilligans island. If you prefer not to take the short ferry ride over to the island, continue down Carr. 333 to the end of the road where you will find the free beach Bahia de la Ballerna which also has a long nature trail running alonng the beach. Breakfast was not inlcuded although the internet indicated that is was. We ordered anyhow ... I would recommend finding a restaurant. My husband had two small freezer burnt pieces of saugage and eggs which later made him sick. I had the spanish omelette (eggs with tomato sauce on top) and toast. I suppose the toast was okay. We were told by staff orange juice was included and that break was discounted for guest, neither of which came true when it came time to pay the bill. On the up side, breakfast is served pool side which was nice. Wifi internet access was available but the connection was poor and were were able to access the internet.

Reviews.Title: “Disgusting Dump”
Reviews.Author: tritravelim
Reviews.Content: Truly the title says it all. Probably one of the worse hotels I've stayed in. Not even during my years as a student on a very tight budget had I stayed in a dump as bad as this one. One night was enough and don't waste your time placing a complaint, clearly the administration couldn't care less. It's incredible how the Puerto Rican sanitation department has not shut this place down. From the mold infested bathrooms and tiles to the greenish water in the pool. By the way, most hotels in the area are only slightly better. Shame on the Puerto Rican tourism department allowing this place to be called a "parador". Whoever has anything good to say about this place has extremely low standards, and the positive reviews...I can only think were placed by the owner.

Reviews.Title: “Awful, terrible and OK”
Reviews.Author: MomTravelerandFamily
Reviews.Content: Traveler beware... we arrived in the evening and were shown to a old, dark room. The sheets looked grey. The carpet and drapes were worn. And, worse - it seemed someone had left a fish in the room for week! After asking the night clerk for a different room, she showed me an even worse one that had black mold spots on the acoustic ceiling tiles and the same worn, smelly ambiance. I was practically speechless. She quickly noticed my dismay and finally moved us to the renovated part of the hotel, which was fine - a motel 6 with slightly nicer quilts and drapes. But, most importantly, it was clean and did not smell. The rest of the stay was fine. However, I would not stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Forgotten Crime Scene?”
Reviews.Author: Diva-xist
Reviews.Content: Roaches, mildew, stained bedsheets, iron-burned rug, cigarrete-burned nightstand, soiled bathtub (gray). Damp smell. Cracked paint on the ceiling. Rude and indefferent front desk lady. If this is the only hotel available, sleep in your car.

Reviews.Title: “no more and no less than ok”
Reviews.Author: DidiJ
Reviews.Content: If what one needs is just a room to sleep in, Perichi's isn't bad. The rooms ar a bit worn, showing their age, but my room was clean enough, the bed was comfortable, the bathroom ok and the pool big enough for a few strokes and a refreshing swim in the morning. I wouldn't chose Perichi's for a whole vacation, but for one or two nights it is - ok.

Reviews.Title: “Great Parador, delicious restaurant, perfect banquets!”
Reviews.Author: miafaro
Reviews.Content: I was invited for my niece's wedding to this hotel. Since it was my first time in the area I did follow the internet advise on this property and didn't book on it instead I booked in the Highway Inn (other review), now I know that the reviews have been made probably with anger or in the glimse of the moment, because it is the best hotel in the area. First I have to say the banquets staff is wonderfull, I mean the zipper of my dress broke before picture session and they helped me mend it. They made special meal for my kids during the wedding, it was great. Anyway, after staying one night at another hotel I came here were all my family was staying and I had a good time. The room was confortable and the bathroom was so big that my husband could actually take a shower without bending. The rooms have carpet when tiles seems to be the norm around. There are phones in the room. The restaurant is the best I had while my stay in Puerto Rico, my kids had home made pasta dishes, my husband some seafood and I had a delicious steak. There is no beach within a walking distance, but you can go on a boat to the little island on front and have a great picnic and day at the beach. We used the BBQ on one of the gazebos and had a family get together. The pool is not deep (6')which was dessapointing for my 6'4" husband, but it was refreshing and the kids had there own little pool to enjoy. The hotel has a limited variety of channels and none for kids for those interested, because my family had a blast at this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Please Remodel soon!”
Reviews.Author: econcepcion2323
Reviews.Content: We were 4 days at the hotel for our anniversary. We are Puerto Rico residents with many years visitsing this hotel. I think it is time to invest in remodeling it. Rugs are old and stained. Although they announce Cable TV, only local channels are available (yes visitors do rest and watch TV while in the room). We did not use the swimming pool because it was dirty. Furniture seems to be 10 to 15 years old and bathrooms leak when using the shower. Though we have good memories of this hotel and the people who work there, we don't think we will stay there again unitl changes are made.

Reviews.Title: “needs improvement, Perich's has potential,staff needs more training”
Reviews.Author: tiger72950
Reviews.Content: My husband was born and lived in P.R. for 5 years of his early life, I am Puerto Rican, but was born and raised in New York City. This is my second time at this parador, and yes it does need alot of TLC, has been neglected and it really needs alot of updating, the staff is pleasant enough but they lack customer service training, Our stay was okay but when we first arrived there was no one to greet us. We arrived at 2:30 AM and we were told that someone would be there to check us in. Because of the inconvienience we were given one free breakfast, the room was musty and not cheery, is out dated. the bed linen looks old and not fresh. My husband and I would like to buy this Parador for we can make so many changes for the better. We have the experience, and I think we can make a difference. The pool we did not used for it had algai. All this place needs is some upgrades and some incentives to be offered to the clients, The lobby does need upgrading and some cleanup, it does look neglected and old, Now the dinning restaurant is nice, needs ambiance. we were treated okay. The rooms need to have Irons and Hair blowers and prettier drapes very old and outdated. We hope to have the opportunity to stay here again but under better conditions. The surrounding areas need alot of improvement and there is no beach! there is water front and maybe at one time before all the housing was put up there was a beach but it needs improvement............ but it has potential......... I hope the owner reads these reviews so that he can make the changes necessary. Its ashame that this area is not being attended too. Puerto Rico needs someone who would care and nourish it. It's a beautiful Island but it's own people don't care......................... People wake up if you don't take care of the Isla del Encanto, it will be no more....................................

Reviews.Title: “Rude, Nasty Staff, Dirty Room, Horrible !”
Reviews.Author: Tenochtitlan1965
Reviews.Content: We saw an ad for this hotel in Que Pasa magazine and thought it mught be nice. But be warned, there is NO BEACH, what they call a beach is a small strip in front of someone else's home. When we got there, the staff in the front desk is rude and nasty. They placed us on the 3rd floor and there are NO ELEVATORS and we have very heavy luggage. We asked for a room in the 1st floor but again we were rudely informed that the hotel was fully booked. Our car was the only car in the parking lot and I realized that evening that we were the only people in that hotel because their restaurant is also empty. We got out of there early the following day, and we asked if they have continental breakfast, coffee and some toast and again we were informed rudely that we have to pay for it. So we got out of there by 7 AM the following day. NEVER AGAIN !

Reviews.Title: “Horrible!!!”
Reviews.Author: bigebulls
Reviews.Content: Terrible experience. Will never do it again. Heed the warning. Dirty stained sheets, dirty walls, and dirty disgusting furniture. Not to mention completely rude staff. You pay american dollars but you get rude staff and dirty room. Couldn't pay me to stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Glorified Crack House with blue toilets and stained covers”
Reviews.Author: wjgrover
Reviews.Content: I will try to be brief and concise. When we arrived at Perichiâ€™s, the first view of the hotel where hanging mattresses that resembled the hanging Gardens of Babylon. We all thought, â€œoh well, they are renovatingâ€� so we didnâ€™t put much thought into it. When we got our keys, accompanied with a generic TV remote, I grabbed our baggage and quickly went to our room to try to get a hot shower after a day of sight seeing. Walking towards the room, I saw that the doors seemed old and rustic; I thought it was part of the ambiance. When I opened the door of the room the hurricane sounding air conditioning was on and the moist/molded/cigarette air embalmed my nostrils with pizzazz. The bed covers had a huge unidentified stain right in the middle of the bed. I quickly took the covers and threw them in the corner of the room. When I do a 360 look around the room, I thought I was in the movie Trainspotting. The walls where stained and cracks where noticeable on the ceiling. When I enter the bathroom there was a blue toilet bowl from the 60â€™s accompanied by a blue sink and blue tub. I have to say that the blue matched perfectly with the blue â€œflower powerâ€� tiles on the wall. I walked back to the room and noticed that they where triangle shaped patterns on the rug. When I took a closer look, I realized that they where hot iron marks. It seems that a several guests left the iron on the floor. After I laughed and told many times to my girlfriend that I was sorry, we laughed and played along with the hotels crack house theme. I went to the front desk to complain about the room and they just stared at me like I was speaking Cantonese. For the record, Iâ€™m from Puerto Rico and my primary language is Spanish. The morning after our arrival we ate breakfast at the hotel. The breakfast was good and I cannot complain about the service. While I was eating, I was looking at the people that where working on the renovation of the hotel. They where spreading a roll of carpet. What was strange is that the carpet seemed old. Then I realized that they where replacing the old carpet with used carpet. Of course, how can you keep a Crack House themed hotel working with new carpet or new appliances. Maybe they just leave the carpet in sea water for days and employ people to intentionally burn the carpets with hot irons just for looks. Overall I have to say that the hotel is a mess, I stayed in the room in the front of the hotel and they seem to be the worst ones in the premises. The staff was nice although the administration keeps the place looking cheap and tasteless. Itâ€™s very sad that on this part of the island there is a limited amount of choices when it comes to hotels or bed&breakfast. My advice is, spend 20 dollars more and stay somewhere else. This is definitely not worth the money. Maybe they should change the name from Perichiâ€™s to Perishâ€™ s.

Reviews.Title: “Nver Again”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: WE travel to this area often.Been to cabo rojo 6 times.This was our worst stay ever.The A/C stopped working the first day.After they got it going again they said do not touch the thermostat.It stopped working again before we left.The room was not cleaned by housekeeping well.Rooms were musty.They told us that the americans are usually the first to complain.We left early after termites infested our room and had to pay for a night we did not sleep there.We will begoing back to Cabo Rojo soon , but not at Perichis.

Reviews.Title: “Be warned”
Reviews.Author: mcap1
Reviews.Content: Stayed here 2 days with my sister; we both know island very well. We stayed at Perichi's on business, not vacation. The brochure for Perichi's, as well as a lot of the PR tourist literature, is misleading. There is no beach in walking distance, at least not any you'd like to bathe in. There is a picture of a beautiful beach in the brochure but if it is the beach the receptionist claimed it was, it is a long car-ride away, and I suspect that it was taken a long time ago when it was still nice. The waterfront by Perichi's is completely covered by a string of eateries and houses, not all in the best condition. The pool faces the parkinglot. The most basic rooms, in the main building, are musty smelling, have no hangers in closet. On plus side, it was clean, staff is very nice and restaurant is good. Eateries along water have good local food.

Reviews.Title: “Pleasant Stay”
Reviews.Author: ILfemale
Reviews.Content: We stayed at this hotel during our recent week-long stay in Puerto Rico, and it was a welcome relief after our hotel in San Juan (reviewed elsewhere.) The hotel was surprisingly empty for January, prime time for a getaway to a warm place by most Midwesterners. I saw no fellow tourists at the hotel the first night, and just a couple on the second night. The Sea is across the street, but behind a row of builidings, with only a small viewing area to walk out by the water. The pool area is nice to sit out on, even if you don't swim. Breakfast is served on a covered verenda overlooking the pool area in the a.m., including fresh pineapple or other locally-grown produce. Out of four hotels we stayed in in Puerto Rico, this was the only one that had carpets on the floors. Hard ceramic tiles seem to the norm elsewhere. The air conditioning was very functional -- especially when the cleaning people turned it down to 17 celcius in our absence! Curtains on the patio doors are quite thin, and the clatter of a nearby school can be heard quite early in the morning, but otherwise this is a nice quiet and private getaway.
